oai_dc:dc.dc:title: HYDRAULIC MODEL TEST OF STABILITY OF AMENITYORIENTED BREAKWATER
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kunitomi, Shoji
Mase, Hajime
Takayama, Tomotsuka
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: hydraulic model
model test
breakwater
breakwater stability
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A slit caisson breakwater has now been under construction at Takamatsu Harbor, Kagawa Prefecture, Japan, as an amenity-oriented breakwater (that is, a human friendly breakwater opened for citizen). However, wave pressures and forces acting on the slit caisson have not been evaluated. Hydraulic experiments are carried out to examine the stability of the slit caisson breakwater and uplift forces on a upper board, and to investigate a desired type of upper board of the breakwater.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 26 (1998): Proceedings of 26th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Copenhagen, Denmark, 1998.
